lexUnit.name: cock.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: bend a (limb or joint) at an angle.

sentence.text: Presented with the noise of a tuning fork , the dog will respond , by turning its head or cocking its ears , but will not salivate .
Lord Christopher nodded towards the house and then cocked an ear back to the shadowy garden .
This was a sinister development ; the horse straightened his head so that he could see better , and cocked an ear at the man .
He cocked his head , trying to hear .
She cocked her head towards the hall , and Ray Doyle led the way into the lounge , where Jack Stone stood by the window , peering round the curtains at the street outside .
Jurnet cocked his head to one side , straining to pronounce what was written obliquely across a lower corner .
She cocked her head to try and make out sounds but there were none .
Ratagan cocked his head to listen to the race of the wind outside that creaked the rafters .
A greyhound cocked his leg against the table and was promptly shooed away .
He cocked an eyebrow at Coffin , who nodded .
When she failed to retort he cocked an eyebrow at her , waiting for the sparring to continue .
Raising heavy lids a fraction , he cocked a quizzical eyebrow at her .
He cocked a sardonic eyebrow at her .
She cocked an eye at Lonie , grunted .
He cocked a brow at me .
Rostov cocked an eye at Yuan , but the aide shook his head .
Stringer cocked a thumb in Morgan 's direction .
They listen for them , cocking their heads to one side to catch the sound of the grub chewing its way through the wood which , since wood is its food , it does most of the time .
He cocked his thumb over his shoulder .
Madge threw herself into the broken armchair and cocked her legs over the side .
He cocked an eye speculatively over the rim .
Wilcox inquired , cocking his eyebrow .
Iris cocked a sceptical eyebrow .
He cocked a shaggy eyebrow .
Howard cocked an eyebrow , intrigued that a newcomer could know such a thing , but the Doctor did n't notice as he continued : ` In the city , it 'll be complete chaos .
` One -- " he cocked a thumb ` -- when you 're trying to creep out of a castle no one is asleep .
Blackbirds hopped -- and paused , heads to one side , then cocked their tails and took off with much commotion to sing full-throatedly from the treetops .
